Artifact.description: Artifacts are used to provide the information that is required to start a deployment. A deployment cannot be created without the artifact information. For an SQL deployment, artifacts serve as SQL texts and user-defined functions (UDFs) or connectors on which the deployment depends. For a JAR deployment, artifacts serve as JAR packages or dependency files. For a Python deployment, artifacts serve as .py files or .zip files.

pythonArtifact.description: The information required for the Python deployment.

kind.description:
The type of the deployment. This parameter is required and cannot be modified after the deployment is created.

*   JAR
*   PYTHON

kind.description:
The type of the start offset. Valid values:

*   NONE: The deployment is started without states.
*   LATEST_SAVEPOINT: The deployment is started from the latest savepoint.

allowNonRestoredState.description: Specifies whether to allow specific operator states to be skipped. This parameter is required only when a Python deployment or a JAR deployment is resumed with state data.

jobStartTimeInMs.description: The time point at which the deployment is started without states. You must enter a 13-digit timestamp. If you set the kind parameter to NONE, you can configure this parameter to allow all source tables for which the startTime parameter is configured to read data from the specified time point.

savepointId.description: The ID of the savepoint for starting the deployment. This parameter is required when the kind parameter is set to FROM_SAVEPOINT.
